DOC.brief_summary: The objective study develop test feasibility , acceptability , initial efficacy novel couples-based behavioral weight symptom management intervention obese breast cancer survivor partner . The propose project consist two phase . Phase I include intervention development refinement . Intervention development guide research team 's prior work , interdependence model communal coping behavior change , information obtain couple participate focus group . The intervention protocol test 5 couple assist refinement intervention content . During phase II , feasibility , acceptability initial efficacy intervention examine . Obese breast cancer survivor first year follow treatment overweight obese partner receive 6 weekly 6 biweekly session total 12 session space across approximately 5 month . The intervention provide couples-based format couple meet separately therapist . Couples assess pre- , post- , 3-months post-treatment . Study outcomes weight , symptom ( i.e. , pain , fatigue , distress ) , eat behavior , physical activity . Exploratory outcomes examine biomarkers ( i.e. , insulin , IL-6 , IL-8 , TNF-alpha , adiponectin ) associate health outcome cancer survivor partner . It hypothesize intervention feasible ( i.e. , complete session ) , participant find intervention acceptable assessed measure treatment acceptability . It also hypothesize participant evidence decrease weight improvement symptom ( i.e. , pain , fatigue , distress ) , eat behavior , physical activity , change weight covary change symptom , eat behavior , daily physical activity . Finally , hypothesize participant great weight loss evidence improve functioning insulin , IL-6 , IL-8 , TNF-Î± , adiponectin , heart rate .
DOC.brief_title: Behavioral Weight Symptom Management Breast Cancer Survivors Partners
DOC.criteria: Phase I : Intervention Development Refinement : Patients : Female , obese ( BMI > 30 ) partner diagnosis nonmetastatic breast cancer ( stage IIII ) complete adjuvant chemotherapy and/or radiation treatment last 5 year healthy enough participate homebased walk program ( participate intervention refinement ) , able speak English able willing give inform consent . Partners : Overweight/obese ( BMI > 25 ) cohabiting partner woman nonmetastatic breast cancer complete adjuvant chemotherapy and/or radiation last 5 year healthy enough participate homebased walk program ( participate intervention refinement ) able speak English able willing give inform consent . patient partner male breast cancer survivor nonambulatory unable provide inform consent major mental illness ( i.e. , schizophrenia ) ; mental illness treated/controlled ( i.e. , bipolar disorder ) reside > 100 mile research site . Phase II : Feasibility , Acceptability , Efficacy Intervention Patients : Female , obese ( BMI > 30 ) partner diagnosis nonmetastatic breast cancer ( stage IIII ) complete adjuvant chemotherapy and/or radiation treatment last year healthy enough participate homebased walk program able speak English able willing give inform consent . Partners : Overweight/obese ( BMI > 25 ) cohabiting partner woman nonmetastatic breast cancer complete adjuvant chemotherapy and/or radiation last year healthy enough participate homebased walk program able speak English able willing give inform consent . patient partner male breast cancer survivor nonambulatory unable provide inform consent major mental illness ( i.e. , schizophrenia ) mental illness treated/controlled ( i.e. , bipolar disorder ) reside > 100 mile research site . Pregnant woman also exclude study .
